intro: Trichomanes tenue, commonly known as the slender water fern, is a small, delicate fern that thrives in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, lance-shaped fronds. The plant has a short, creeping rhizome and produces small, inconspicuous spore-bearing structures on the undersides of its leaves. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing on rocks or decaying wood. Due to its delicate structure and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
